subject: PE Today: Duke Redux
body:
CBSNews.com













Duke 
      Story To Be Heavily Featured On "Evening News"According to Katie Couric, who 
      will be interviewing the parents of one of the accused players, "we'll be 
      spending most of the broadcast tonight focused on this story." In a 
      somewhat suprising move, the "Evening News" has relocated to Raleigh, 
      North Carolina for the story. "We're here because this really is a story 
      that is about so many important issues in our society today," says Couric. 
      [+ Read More]



More 
      Details About "Couric & Co." IncidentYesterday, I 
      posted an item about the "Couric & Co." blog 
      apologizing for an "omission" involving the April 4 installment of "Katie 
      Couric's Notebook." The Notebook, which has been removed from the site, 
      bore striking similarities to a Jeffrey Zaslow piece in 
      the Wall Street Journal, though no acknowledgment was made of Zaslow's 
      work. Today, new details have been made public. The first, and most 
      significant, is that a producer has been fired. [+ Read More]



A Guest 
      Again? (In
Three Parts)
Three CBS News folks share their 
      opinions on whether they will go back on the Don Imus 
      radio show. The most provocative quote comes from soon-to-be CBS News 
      Senior Political Correspondent Jeff Greenfield, who 
      says to "stay away from the show when he gets in serious and deserved 
      trouble seems to me the ultimate act of hypocrisy and cowardice." 
      [+ Read More] [+ Read More] [+ Read More]
